text: KCC councillor Paul Messenger says he has withdrawn as candidate at Thanet council election:  'I fully accept my suspension and any further disciplinary action which may follow. And, of course, I am standing down as a candidate for TDC councillor in Margate Central."

text: Abrupt U-turn by Conservative councillor Paul Messenger  over Islamophobic comments he claimed had been the result òf someone hacking his Facebook account. Now admits he did post them..  #Thanet

text: Aoology from KCC councillor Paul Messenger over offensive posts on Muslims: 'It is absolutely unforgiveable that I didn’t delete these posts from my timeline.  And it is equally unforgiveable that I didn’t publicly refute them.  I do so now."
author: PaulOnPolitics

text: Conservative county councillor Paul Messenger admits he did post offensive statements about Muslims: 'I want to apologise unreservedly for the historic Islamophobia that I put up on social media. They are no longer my views and never should have been my views in the first place.'
